lines: (We were exhausted, nearly out of food and at the end of our wits by the time we had made it to the gates of Irinipolis.)

lines.Vitus: "I don't remember the city being this big."

lines.Volesus: "Well, it isn't compared to the capital."
"But you haven't been here in years."

lines.Herclaus: "I cannot wait to take a proper bath."

lines.Cerkles: "I don't need much, but I would be grateful for a hearty meal."

lines.Krokos: "I can keep myself clean and fed, but I'm starved for conversation."
"Hopefully I can busy myself with the company of an arcanist or two if I mill about the forum."

lines.Zermes: "Maybe they can help you dislodge the stick up your ass."

lines.Krokos: "That sounds more like your sort of pastime."

lines.Zermes: "So I see you've read about me."
"No need to be shy about that."

lines.Krokos: "I promise you that I've done more than reading."
"You should probably stop speaking to me unless you're prepared to be mebarrassed."

lines.Zermes: "You think you can make me blush?"
"That's real cute, kitten."

lines: (We could hear Cerkles hum with concern while Herclaus looked back and forth between the bickering cats with a panicked look on his face.)
(But the guards weren't letting us through.)
(They told us that they couldn't take in any more refugees into the city due to overcrowding.)
(But when Zermes showed one of the men how his chalice worked, the man became consumed with curiosity and longing.)

lines.Zermes: "Why don't you try it then?"
"I always let anybody pull from my cup for free, the first time."

lines: (The man put his paw into the chalice, and pulled out a glittering piece of hold jewellery.)

lines.Guard: "This... this looks like a diamond ring?!"

lines.Zermes: "It looks like it must have been your lucky day."
"That barely ever happens."

lines.Vitus: "Thank the heavens."

lines.Cerkles: "...Can you control what comes out of that cup?"

lines.Zermes: "...Probably!"
"It's both situational and conditional."
"...In all honesty, the plan was to make him draw garbage, then to make him let us pass in exchange for more uses of the chalice."
"But he was so happy with that first pull, wasn't he?!"
"We really lucked out."

lines.Cerkles: "What if the man would have drawn poorly once, and only let one of us pass?"
"And then on a second pull, he drew something really great?"
"Couldn't that have stranded one of our summoners outside?"

lines.Zermes: "...Like I said, we really lucked out! That was great!"

lines.Herclaus: "We made it through this harrowing journey only because we stayed true to ourselves."

lines.Zermes: "Perfectly put my friend."

lines.Krokos: "This has nothing to do with anything we just talked about."

lines.Vitus: "Let's look forward, shall we?"

lines.Volesus: "Yes, let's look forward."
"We should look for temporary lodgings while we attempt to untangle this mess."
"I know a place in the noble district."

lines: (We parted ways with our travelling companions, though they were sorry to see us go.)
(Or, more specifically, they were sorry to lose access to the chalice Zermes carried with him.)
(There was barely room to walk within the city walls due to how packed the crowds were, but Volesus directed us as best as he could...)
(...Directly to a checkpoint, guarded by more soldiers.)

lines.Volesus: "We have to get through."

lines.Vitus: "Another gateway inside the city?"
"Look, you can see that there's hardly anyone on the other side!"
"It's not overcrowded at all."

lines.Volesus: "Be calm."
"If you make a scene, they'll never let us through."
"Excuse me, sir. Might we pass through? We have business in the noble district."

lines: (Volesus made a grand gesture at us.)

lines.Volesus: "Myself, and my travelling companion. And our four servants."
"Our two bodyguards, our tutor, and our holy man."

lines: (The guard's eyes widened as he looked over our clothes and the presence that the Heroes gave off.)

lines.Guard: "A tutor? And a holy man, you said?"

lines.Volesus: "So it's as I thought... they're only letting the wealthy pass."

lines.Vitus: "But what about the rest of these people?"

lines.Volesus: "If we want to help any of them later, we'll have to help ourselves first."
"We need food and rest."

lines: (The streets on the other side of the gate were calm and quiet.)
(Flowers blossomed neatly in curated beds, and people strolled by, greeting us cordially.)
(But the quiet was uncomfortable to us, knowing about the noise beyond the gate.)
(It took about half an hour to get to the inn that Volesus suggested.)
(The accomodations inside were cosy; nothing at all like the front of the city with the packed crowds and the awful smells.)
(Word travelled fast in the city about "the two resourceful men in robes with servants who could wield incredible powers...")
(...Such that all eyes were upon us when we entered the tavern, and people whispered about us.)
(A tall man with striking eyes wearing a heavy perfume rushed to greet us.)

lines.Innkeeper: "Good afternoon, men. A party of six I presume? Shall I get you a table, or would you like to purchase rooms?"

lines.Vitus: "A room could be helpful so we can put away all of our belongings."

lines.Innkeeper: "Very well. How many rooms and beds will you need?"

lines.Vitus: "I don't know exactly."
"Hold on."
"How many beds will we need?"

lines.Volesus: "That's a good question."

lines.Vitus: "Do the summoned Heroes eventually disappear?"

lines.Volesus: "They've been sleeping like normal ever since they've been here."
"Should I ask them if they can just disappear?"

lines.Vitus: "That would be incredibly rude..."

lines.Volesus: "I think you're right."

lines.Vitus: "I think we'll take that table for now."
"Might give us time to think about our arrangements..."

lines.Innkeeper: "Very well. What shall I bring you, then?"

lines.Vitus: "Ah, how about a jug of water and six glasses?"

lines: (The inkeeper nodded, and left the table.)

lines.Volesus: "Six glasses? We've... never seen these four eat or drink."

lines.Vitus: "Wait, really?"
"Surely they've just done it in private."
"Huh."

lines.Krokos: "The three of us agreed it would be wise not to consume any of your rations on the road when you were already low."

lines.Cerkles: "We didn't want either of you to run low on energy."

lines.Vitus: "The three of you, you say?"

lines.Zermes: "Oh, loosen up. They didn't come close to running out due to my help."

lines.Cerkles: "That's true... but it's also because the three of us abstained from meals."

lines.Zermes: "If I'm forced to be here then I should at the very least get to feel like I'm alive."
"That's a reasonable request, surely."

lines.Cerkles: "Well, maybe trying out one of those biscuits wouldn't have hurt..."

lines.Vitus: "If any of you want to eat, I think you should."
"There's no reason to go without. We could have figured something out."
"But okay, then. Back to more pressing business."
"If we're getting rooms, then how many should we purchase?"

lines.Zermes: "Well if there's six of us, we should naturally get six rooms."

lines.Vitus: "Six rooms?! Isn't that a waste of money?"

lines.Volesus: "Vitus and I are used to sharing rooms, so we plan to do so anyways."

lines.Herclaus: "I'm used to sleeping anywhere. The floor would suffice."

lines.Cerkles: "I don't mind the floor either if we can save monera."

lines.Vitus: "Neither of you need to sleep on the floor."

lines.Volesus: "But if they're willing to cut costs..."

lines.Vitus: "No."

lines.Volesus: "So that would be a minimum of five beds and four rooms."
"Right. I'll go check in with the innkeeper."

lines: (We all watch quietly as Volesus speaks with the Innkeeper, quirk his brow, and then amkes his way back over to the table, telling us the price.)

lines.Vitus: "No way. Are you kidding?!"
"That's more monera than I've seen in my life."

lines.Volesus: "They have the impression that we're very rich."

lines.Zermes: "Well... you could be, if you leave it to me."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Ugh. There he goes again, about to show off the bad habits you gave him."

lines.Mukaki: "I don't know what you're talking about!"
"His habits were bad before I did anything."

lines.Vitus: "I was wondering where you two had been."

lines.Volesus: "Wait... it looks like we caught somebody's attention."

lines: (A well dressed nobleman, who seems to have just entered the tavern had his eyes locked on us.)
(A few other nobles leaned into his ear, whipsering, and he nodded, then stoop up, approaching us.)

lines.Noble: "Good afternoon, my friends. You all appear to be the talk of the city right now."

lines.Vitus: "Unfortunately."

lines.Volesus: "We're just a band of travellers."

lines.Noble: "That's an odd thing to call a couple of Crown Mages."
"Travelling with Herclaus, the Guardian of the Holy Capital."

lines.Volesus: "...Okay, you have our attention."

lines.Sulpicius: "And I am the acting governor of Irinipolis."

lines.(Mukaki: "That's the dumbest lie I've ever heard. Who would believe that?")

lines.Vitus: "...I'm so glad he can't hear you two right now."
"Uh, that doesn't matter."

lines.(Herclaus: "I'd recognise the crest on the broach anywhere.)
"I think he really is the governor.)

lines.(Makari-Hari: "He's not being very careful if that's the case.")

lines.(Zermes: "Well I have no doubt that he's exactly who he says he is.")
"He has the right air about him.")

lines.(Krokos: "That's the coy way of saying that we'll know the truth soon enough anyway.)

lines: (Zermes shot Krokos a glare.)
(Cerkles was sipping his cup, as if he was embarrassed to say anything.)

lines.Sulpicius: "Well, if I had any doubts that you were strangers before, those doubts are clear."
"But why not immediately see for yourself if I'm telling the truth?"
"Now come along! I've already paid for your drinks."

lines: (We all got up, giving one another wary looks as we left our finished glasses on the table and followed the nobleman out the front door.)
(The first tip-off that the noble wasn't lying about his position was the group of ten city guards waiting for him outside of the tavern.)
(They watched the back of our necks as they marched us through the street, up through the noble district and to a gate that separated us from a sizable manor.)

lines.Sulpicius: "I overheard your conversation about the board being too expensive."
"Why not stay with me instead at the governor's mansion?"
"I'd have room for all of you, of course."

lines: (The bear looks uncomfortable, as if he's afraid to touch anything.)

lines.Zermes: "Too kind, one could say."
"Because nothing is actually free."

lines.Sulpicius: "...The truth of the matter is, this city is unprepared for war."
"The capital has asked me with managing its defence, and frankly, I'm overwhelmed."
"Its defences on the exterior cumble while the foundations of its interior rot within."
"Every educated noble in the capital knows the stories of the legendary Heroes and their... attendants; of how they had turned hopeless war efforts to their favour in the past."

lines.Vitus: "But sir... we aren't like those other Crown Mages from the past."
"Our mentor left us a long time ago and we haven't seen him for years."
"We're the last of our order, netiher of us know magic... and we barely have access to many artefacts."
"Who knows how many were lost, stolen or destroyed when the rebel army sacked the academy."

lines.Sulpicius: "At this point, I'm willing to try anything to give us a fighting chance."
"All I ask is that you both try your best, and you can stay here for as long as you want."

lines.Volesus: "...Or until the rebel army gets here, should we fail."

lines.Vitus: "Well..."
"It's not like we have anywhere else to go at the moment."

lines.Volesus: "Let's give it out best shot."

lines.Sulpicius: "So long as we're helping each other... please... make yourselves at home."

lines: END
